title: How to Find Your Phone Number on Android

steps.title: Open the Phone app.
steps.content: Open the Phone app. It generally has an icon that resembles an old phone receiver. Tap the app icon

steps.title: Tap the Contacts tab.
steps.content: Tap the Contacts tab. It's the third tab at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Me, My info, or your name.
steps.content: Tap Me , My info , or your name. It is generally at the top of the page. Depending on what phone model you have, it will either say Me or My Info . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Check your phone number.
steps.content: Check your phone number. It will be listed below "Phone number" or "Mobile". [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Android’s Settings .
steps.content: Open your Android’s Settings . It’s the gear icon most commonly found in the app drawer. If you don’t see a gear, look for a wrench. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap About phone or About Device.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap About phone or About Device . It's near the bottom of the Settings menu. If you are using a Samsung Galaxy, it will be listed near the top of this page. For all other Android phone models, continue to the next step. [4] X Research source If you don't see this option on the root Settings menu, tap System . You should find it there.

steps.title: Tap Status or Phone identity.
steps.content: Tap Status or Phone identity . On some phone models, you phone number may be listed at the top of this page. If it is not, continue to the next step.

steps.title: Tap SIM Status .
steps.content: Tap SIM Status . Your phone number should appear on this screen under “My phone number.” [5] X Research source If the phone number says "Unknown," you can find your phone number in the Contacts app.
